TextView.android:text: Benjamin Crookston, PhD, MPH. I have worked for the last 10 years addressing children's nutrition, growth, and health in Asia, Africa and Latin America. I care deeply about providing people everywhere with the opportunity to lead happy and healthy lives. I joined COUNTBITES because I believe that portion control is a sustainable approach to healthy weight management while also benefitting people living in resource-poor settings (Bites4Bites). I completed a master degree in public health from Brigham Young University and a doctoral degree from the University of Utah. I currently work as an Assistant Professor at Brigham Young University. In my spare time, I love spending time with my family, mountain biking, and being outdoors.

Cougar Hall, PhD. I am currently an assistant professor in the Department of Health Science at Brigham Young University. For almost 20 years I have lectured on micro- and macro-nutrients, promoted the Dietary Guidelines for Americans, and encouraged the counting and tracking of calories. I understand the qualitative differences in nutritional choices, and yet in the fight against obesity I am willing to lose a battle to win the war! In my professional opinion counting bites is the best way for overweight and obese individuals to measure and monitor dietary intake on their path to a healthy weight. I have a masters degree in health promotion and education and a PhD in teaching and learning. I am crazy about my wife and kids, mountain biking, trail running, Pearl Jam, and bite counting.

I completed a masters degree in public health at San Diego State University where I worked in behavioral epidemiology. I completed my PhD in health behavior at the University of California, San Diego.
